content.description:
A student performed an experiment to study the rate of reaction between solid magnesium, <math alttext="M g, solid " overflow="scroll"> <mi>Mg</mi> <mpadded> <mo>(</mo> <mpadded> <mi>s</mi> </mpadded> <mo>)</mo> </mpadded> </math>, and aqueous hydrochloric acid, <math alttext="H C l, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mi>HCl</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math>. The student conducted two trials under different experimental conditions, using <math alttext="0.10 mole" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.10</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mol</mtext></math> of <math alttext="M g, solid" overflow="scroll"><mi>Mg</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>s</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> and <math alttext="1.00 mole" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.00</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mol</mtext></math> of <math alttext="H C l, aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mi>HCl</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> in each trial.

Trial
 Completion Time (seconds)

<math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>
 <math alttext="37" overflow="scroll"><mn>37</mn></math>

<math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>
 <math alttext="59" overflow="scroll"><mn>59</mn></math>
content.question: Which of the following changes in conditions could account for the difference in the time for the reaction to go to completion in trial <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and trial <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"> <mn>2</mn> </math> ?

choices.label: The mixture of reactants was stirred in trial <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, but not in trial <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>.
The temperature of the hydrochloric acid was higher in trial <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.
The concentration of the hydrochloric acid was greater in trial <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.
The solid magnesium was a fine powder in trial <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> but a single chunk in trial <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.

content.answer: The solid magnesium was a fine powder in trial <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> but a single chunk in trial <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.

skill.text: 2.F: Explain how modifications to an experimental procedure will alter results.
